required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Valiant Mona LSA Stent Graft System
clinical_study.official_title: Valiant Mona LSA Stent Graft System Early Feasibility Study

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The Valiant Mona LSA thoracic stent graft system is for the endovascular repair of aneurysms of the descending thoracic aorta (DTA) in patients who require coverage of the left subclavian artery (LSA).The study is intended to assess safety and performance of the device acutely and at 30 days.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Cumulative Major Adverse events (including aneurysm-related mortality, stroke, paraplegia, and left arm/hand ischemia)

secondary_outcome.description: Endoleak of all types from the stent graft

arm_group.arm_group_label: Valiant Mona LSA Stent Graft System
arm_group.description: TEVAR procedure using Medtronic Stent Graft

intervention.intervention_name: Valiant Mona LSA Stent Graft System
intervention.description: All subjects will be implanted with this device
intervention.arm_group_label: Valiant Mona LSA Stent Graft System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject is at least 18 years of age.
- The subject or legal guardian understands the nature of the study and agrees to its provisions on a written informed consent form
- Subject must be considered a candidate for revascularization of the LSA.
- Subject has a DTA which will require coverage of the LSA
- Subject's anatomy must meet the anatomical criteria to receive that implanted device
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has had previous endovascular repair of the ascending and/or descending thoracic aorta.
- Subject is in acute renal failure or has renal insufficiency with a serum creatinine â‰¥ 2.0 mg/dL
- Subject is a pregnant female.
- Enrollment in another clinical study
- Subject has had a cerebral vascular accident (CVA)or myocardial infarction (MI) within 3 months.
- Subject has a history of bleeding diathesis, coagulopathy, or refuses blood transfusion.
- Subject has a known allergy or intolerance to the device components.
- Subject has a known hypersensitivity or contraindication to anticoagulants or contrast media, which is not amenable to pre-treatment.

facility.name: St George's Vascular Institute, St. George's Hospital
